text: Yeah, this is a good song and yeah, he has a lot of emotion in it. However, I can’t help but to be concerned because he’s showing big signs of drug abuse. I had to watch it twice to show my husband (who’s in recovery), and it triggered him. He said, “he’s high” and I had to painfully agree because I watched my now husband act the same way when he was high. No one is saying anything about this, and it sucks because these lyrics alone scream that he’s beat. And all anyone can do is applaud his acting and vocals. He’s a real person, and he’s in trouble. I’m a HUGE fan, always have been. So, this is not meant to be an ill intended comment. I just needed to point out that Post is struggling and none of you noticed. Maybe none of you have seen anyone in active addiction (with opiates specifically), but they act just like this. Slow. Eyes closed. Hands doing weird things. That drowsy putting hand to the mouth movement. It just makes me really sad to see him this way. I truly hope he isn’t battling addiction, we have lost so many artists/actors recently due to overdoses. But, he has made it clear as day that he’s in overdrive. And when people are in overdrive, they find something to slow down. My thoughts are with Posty.

text:
For anyone who wants to play this on guitar, here's how :)

- Standard Tuning - Capo 1st Fret -

- Structure Of The Song -
Verse, Chorus, Verse, Chorus, Verse, Chorus

- Verse -
C, G, Dm, F

For each chord, strum:
Down  Down  Down   Down, Up

- Chorus -
E, F
C*, C/B*, Am, Am
A#sus2, F
C, C, CM7, CM7

For each chord, strum:
Down  Down  Down   Down, Up
*Down   Down, Up

Hope this helps out! If you get stuck or need a little extra help, I posted a video lesson for this on my channel :)

text:
Post, Austin... you ever get back to Grapevine? I know you probably dont read these texts... but I graduated from grapevine in 93... lived off hall Johnson, countryside drive.

Anyway, started listen to you a few years back... then one day, I found out you were from grapevine... I thought, that is cool as f@ck... do you know how many MIPs I got from the cops... evert weekend... at least one... back then, it was 85 dollars, they'd keep our beers ( dick move, I still like cops, not all, but there are cool ones... ) hell, they had my name and my buddy Mike's already written on the citations on Friday nights because they knew we were out drinking parked at Monticello when it was being developed...

Of you ever read this, let me know if you ever get back there... I haven't in about 25 years... just thought it was cool to see someone come up big out of there.

No, I wasn't one of those rich fucks. But, I partied with everyone... and the stuck up cack suckers, they'd take there shoes off at the door at their parties, we'd go in for about 10 mins, they'd try to tell us we have to go, so we'd steal their shoes heading out the door... stupid shite...

Keep making music, it moves the world, and, great work so far...
author: Todd Withey
